comments.raw_text: We are currently sending a larger- than-expected number of events to Amplitude. Ashley, is having FFTV events in Amplitude something that you still use?
comments.creator: fbertsch@mozilla.com
comments.author: fbertsch@mozilla.com
comments.text: We are currently sending a larger- than-expected number of events to Amplitude. Ashley, is having FFTV events in Amplitude something that you still use?

comments.raw_text: Hi Frank! Yes, I've been using it recently as discussions have come up around what to do next with FFTV. If those same events exist in telemetry, we could remove it from Amplitude, but I might reach out to the data team for help with questions as that investigation goes on.
comments.creator: athomas@mozilla.com
comments.text: Hi Frank! Yes, I've been using it recently as discussions have come up around what to do next with FFTV. If those same events exist in telemetry, we could remove it from Amplitude, but I might reach out to the data team for help with questions as that investigation goes on.
comments.author: athomas@mozilla.com

comments.text:
(In reply to athomas from comment #1)
> Hi Frank! Yes, I've been using it recently as discussions have come up around what to do next with FFTV. If those same events exist in telemetry, we could remove it from Amplitude, but I might reach out to the data team for help with questions as that investigation goes on.

Hey Ashley, those events do indeed live in telemetry. We can certainly help you with queries, but we won't be able to help day-to-day; i.e. there will be a delay between requests and dashboards.

Does that sound acceptable to you? Can you also describe what kinds of analyses you'll be doing to determine the future of FFTV?
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to athomas from comment #1)
> Hi Frank! Yes, I've been using it recently as discussions have come up around what to do next with FFTV. If those same events exist in telemetry, we could remove it from Amplitude, but I might reach out to the data team for help with questions as that investigation goes on.

Hey Ashley, those events do indeed live in telemetry. We can certainly help you with queries, but we won't be able to help day-to-day; i.e. there will be a delay between requests and dashboards.

Does that sound acceptable to you? Can you also describe what kinds of analyses you'll be doing to determine the future of FFTV?
comments.author: fbertsch@mozilla.com
comments.creator: fbertsch@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text:
Yes, that works for me. There are 2 primary graphs I've been revisiting as part of the decision on next steps:
* The n-day retention as partial validation of product-market fit https://analytics.amplitude.com/mozilla-corp/chart/oym53g4 It would be great to have a way to still view that in future
* Pocket tile clicks to help them decide if they should keep pocket around (uniques and totals) https://analytics.amplitude.com/mozilla-corp/chart/new/vbhczcb
comments.author: athomas@mozilla.com
